shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) ʾOrit zä-lǝdät “Genesis” (fols. 5ra-42vb), incomplete (the beginning is missing) II) ʾOrit zä-ḍäʾat “Exodus“ (fols. 43ra-74va) III) ʾOrit zä-lewawǝyan “Leviticus” (fols. 74vb-100ra) IV) ʾOrit zä-ḫwǝlqw “Numbers“ (fols. 100rb-138va) V) ʾOrit zä-dagǝm “Deuteronomy” (fols. 139ra- 170va) VI) ʾOrit zä-Yoseʿ “Joshua” (fols. 170vb-194vb) VII) ʾOrit zä-mäsafǝnt “Judges” (fols. 194vb-216ra) VIII) ʾOrit zä-Rut “Ruth” (fols. 216rb-216vb), incomplete (the end missing)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: The hand is very similar, or possibly even identical, to that of Ms. VatLib Aeth. 263 (Book of Isaiah, Ascension of Isaiah, Book of Daniel, s. LanVat 465, in which Ṣäga Mättä [sic (Ṣäga Mäṭaʿ?)] is indicated as possible scribe). On the dating of Aeth. 263, s. UhlPal.

dcomments.dcomment: Pre-1350(?). Fols. 1-2 and 3-4 (quire A) originate from two different Mss., comparable in age with the age of the main textblock.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was probably rebound and resewn. Half of the front board is missing. Leather cover is torn off, only turn-ins are preserved. A few leaves originating from two different Mss. were included in quire I. Most of the fols. are badly damaged by water and fire, esp. in the upper part of the leaves, with loss of some text. Text abraded in fols. 149v-150r. Fol. 89 (Lev 8:35–10:8) is misplaced (should be between fols. 80-81). Gen. 1:1–3:7 and Ruth 2:2–4:22 are missing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (half of the front board is missing), covered with reddish-brown leather cover (to the most part missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Quires I-IV, VIII-XVI, XIX-XXVII are reinforced by parchment guards. Parchment repairs are visible on fols. 18, 25, 49, 58, 65, 66, 73, 130, 131, 138.

txfolios.txfolio: Foliation mistakes: number 126 is missing; number 209 is used twice (the image has got number 209a).

squires.squire:
{A(4/fols. 1r-4v)} – I(5; s.l. no, no stub/fols. 5r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(9; s.l. 9, stub before 1/fols. 34r-42v) – VI(7; s.l. 7, stub before 1/fols. 43r-49v) – VII(9; s.l. 9, stub before 1/fols. 50r-58v) – VIII(7; s.l. 7, stub before 1/fols. 59r-65vr) – IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – XIV(8/fols. 106r-113v) – XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XVI(8/fols. 122r-130v) – XVII(7; s.l. 1, no stub/fols. 131r-137v) – XVIII(8/fols. 138r-145v) – XIX(8/fols. 146r-153v) – XX(8/fols. 154r-161v) – XXI(8/fols. 162r-169v) – XXII(8/fols. 170r-177v) – XXIII(8/fols. 178r-185v) – XXIV(8/fols. 186r-193v) – XXV(8/fols. 194r-201v) – XXVI(8/fols. 202r-209v) – XXVII(8/fols. 209ar-217v).
In quire A, fols. 1-2 and 3-4 originate from two different old manuscripts, resp.

taunit.mr-info: All data for fol. 136r. The size of the written area varies throughout the Ms.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/J. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Portions of the text appear to have been written in different hands, cp. fols. 27vb, 30v, 39ra, 66r-v, 74ra (possibly), 77v (possibly), 111vb, 127vb, 194vb, etc.

rubrications.rubrication: Titles of most of the texts are written on the incipit and repeated on the explicit pages; a few lines on the incipit pages of each texts alternating with black lines; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; the words wä-näbäbo ʾǝgziʾa bǝḥer lä-Muse (e.g., fols. 102va, 103vb, 105rb etc.); the words wä-yǝbelomu ʾǝgziʾa bǝḥer lä-Muse(fol. 118vb); in some cases, zǝyä-sign, fols. 122v, 124r

otherdetails.otherdetail: In the text on fol. 186, there is a gap from Josh. 18:8 to Josh. 18:14. The missing passage Josh 18:8-14 is found transposed in fols. 189va-190ra, in the middle of Josh 21:34. The error can not be explained by the displacement of the folio, and it is unlikely that it arose during the writing. The transposition was probably already present in the exemplar used by the scribe for of UM-040 (A. Bausi).

additional.cont: Fols. 1r-2v: Homily by John Chrysostom on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass”, incomplete (beginning and end missing).
additional.det: The fols. (ca. 31 lines) are a fragment of a different, older Ms., possibly Book of the Rite of the Holy Week or a homiliary. For the text, the Homily attributed to John Chrysostom on the words of Jesus in a passage of the Gospel of Matthew (“Father, if it is possible, let this chalice pass away from me”, Mt. 26:39), s. M. GEERARD, Clavis Patrum Graecorum, 4 vols. Turnhout 1974-83 (Corpus Christianorum. Series Graeca), CPG no. 4654. Cp. also D.V. PROVERBIO, La recensione etiopica dell’omelia pseudocrisostomica de ficu exarata ed il suo tréfonds orientale, Wiesbaden 1998 (AeF 50), p.71ff. and 104. The homily is included in Mäṣḥafä gǝbrä ḥǝmamat among the readings for Good Friday; cp. Tasfā Gabra Sellāsē, ግብረ፡ ሕማማት። ዘአኅተሞ፡ ተስፈ፡ ገብረ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ዘሀገረ፡ ቡልጋ። አዲስ፡ አበባ፡ በ፲፱፻፹፪፡ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በተስፋ፡ ገብረ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ማተሚያ፡ ቤት፡ ታተመ።; the full text of the homily is in pp. 257a–262a; the passage in pp. 259b l.13–262a l.12. This is probably the oldest known witness of the homily, which is attested in Ms. EMML 1763, fols. 204v-209r (dating to 1336/37 or 1339/40). (A. Bausi).
The fols. are a fragment of a different, older Ms., possibly Octateuch (the hand must be later than that of Additio 1). The order of the fols. should be reversed: 4-3 (A. Bausi)

extras.extra: - Corrections, omitted letters or words written interlineally: fols. 7vb, 11vb, 13ra, 14vb, 16ra, 16va, 19rb, 20ra, 20vb, 21rb, 21vb, 37ra, 71ra, 90v, 101rb, 101va, 113ra-b, 124vb, 126vb, 128ra-b, 128va-b, 129ra, 129va-b, 130ra-b, 133ra, 134ra-b, 134va, 135va and 136ra (a line). - Erasures: fols. 10rb, 106rb, 132vb, 133rb, 188vb, 199va. - Corrections written over erasures: fols. 21vb, 33rb, 85ra, 102ra, 129vb, 131rb (several lines), 132va, 133rb, 134rb, 157rb, 200rb. - A sign in the shape of cross or tämälläs-sign (impossible to check in some cases, because the margins are destroyed): fol. 6r, 19r, 23r, 26r, 38ra, 38va, 53r, 59r, 65v, 85v, 129r, 130v(?), 132v, 134r, 145v, etc. - Qwǝm-sign accompanied by a cross, in red ink, to the left side from the column: fol. 37v; isolated 119v, - Zǝyä-sign: fols. 11r, 18v, 33r, 120r, 122v, 129r, 189v. - Zǝyä-sign accompanied by coronis: fol. 124r, 144v. Titles of the Old Testament books are written in incipit pages (accompanied by crux ansata and coronis-signs to the left), in simple frames made of black and red dots, and repeated in the explicit page, also sometimes in frames, followed by a chain of coronis-signs. - Coronis-signs: fols. 92r. - Writing exercises: fol. 138v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margins written in red, referring to the content of Text III: fols. 19r, 91r, 92r, 105v, 122v, 124r, 144v. - A black thread is inserted in the margin of fol. 194.
